Name: Extending funeral benefits to NYC auxiliary police officers.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to extending funeral benefits to New York City auxiliary police officers.

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
This Introduction was Sine Die (Filed, End of Session)

Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
Section 1.  Section 14-147 of chapter 1 of title 14 of the administrative code of the city of New York is hereby amended by adding a new subdivision c, to read as follows:
§14-147 Workers’ compensation and funeral benefits for members of auxiliary police.
c. Funeral benefits for auxiliary police. Funeral expenses for an auxiliary police officer who dies while engaged in the discharge of duty shall be paid by the city. 
§2.  This local law shall become effective ninety days after its enactment.

LS #607
OP
Int. 335/2006
4/21/10
